Gilbert Joseph Engler

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/4156424923079145
  • Última atualização do currículo em 13/07/2017

Graduate in Biological Sciences-Zoology at the University of Gent-Belgium (1972). Ph.D. obtained in Biological Sciences from the laboratory of Genetics of Profs. J. Schell and M. Van Montagu at the University of Gent-Belgium (1979). Full-time teaching and research assistant at the Institute of Histology at the Faculty of Medicine, University Gent-Belgium (1974 -1985). Scientific collaborator and group leader of the Microscopy Unit at the Plant Genetics laboratory, University Gent-Belgium (1985-1991). Since 1991 Research Engineer from the French National Agronomical Research Institute (INRA) heading the Cell Biology / Microscopy Unit at the INRA ?Agrobiotech? centre in Sophia Antipolis (France). Since 2013 Visiting professor (CAPES) at Embrapa Cenargen Brasilia DF and actually Visiting Researcher (PVE-CNPq) at the Embrapa Cerrados and Cenargen Institute Brasilia DF. Experience in plant cell biology involving research on cell division, plant cytoskeleton and plant/nematode interactions. Expertise in botanical electron and optical microscopy and related in-situ visualization methods. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2009 - 2013
Deconvolution of Augmented Images in Multi-Dimensional Optical Microscopy
Descrição: The aim of the project is an exhaustive study of two new optical imaging strategies: fluorescence-tomographic microscopy and confocal macroscopy. The development of more effective and user-friendly deconvolution methods for biological and medical research will help to improve the quality of microscopic images and their interpretation. Such improvements will contribute to the better understanding of basic functions of living organisms. In addition to publications, some of the results will be made available and valorized as free softwares and the commercially valuable remainder will be negociated with interested manufacturers..
Situação: Desativado; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (3) .

Integrantes: Gilbert Joseph Engler - Integrante / J Zerubia - Coordenador / L Blanc - Integrante / C Chaux - Integrante / A Dieterlen - Integrante / JC OlivoMarin - Integrante / H Talbot - Integrante / J Pesquet - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Agence National de Recherche - Auxílio financeiro.
